arm_group.arm_group_label: Lung transplant recipients with uncomplicated diverticulitis
arm_group.description: Retrospective data analysis of treatment, outcome and recurrency-rate

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lung transplant recipients with complicated diverticulitis
arm_group.description: Retrospective data analysis of treatment, outcome and recurrency-rate

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess incidence, treatment modalities and outcome of
      complicated and uncomplicated diverticulitis in highly immunosuppressed lung transplant
      recipients (LTRs) in order to establish improved treatment strategies in this high risk
      patient collective.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiology of Diverticulitis in Lung Transplant Recipients

detailed_description.textblock:
Sigmoid diverticulitis is common and potentially problematic in immunosuppressed patients.
      The choice between conservative and surgical treatment for uncomplicated diverticulitis
      remains unclear, as well as the value of the Hartmann's procedure (HP) for complicated
      diverticulitis.

      Our aim is to assess incidence, treatment options and outcome of complicated and
      uncomplicated diverticulitis in highly immunosuppressed lung transplant recipients (LTRs) by
      retrospectively analysing our prospective database of around 400 lung transplant recipients
      transplanted between 1992 and 2013.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Lung transplant recipient

          -  Diverticulitis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

study_pop.textblock:
We want to retrospectively analyse our prospective database of lung transplant recipients
        at our institution between 1992 and 2013 with diverticulitis episodes.

facility.name: Department of Visceral- and Transplant Surgery, University Hospital of Zurich

clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Follow-up of Lung Transplant Recipients With Diverticulitis

primary_outcome.description: Our aim is to assess incidence, treatment options and outcome of complicated and uncomplicated diverticulitis in highly immunosuppressed lung transplant recipients (LTRs) by retrospectively analysing a prospective database of around 400 LTRs transplanted between 1992 and 2013.
primary_outcome.measure: Epidemiology of Diverticulitis in Lung Transplant Recipients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
